slide.title: Description Languages are API Lingua Francas

ul.li: Yes, but…
APIs should be described in a standardized way
APIs are intended for consumption by machines
Machine-readable documentation is called description
Or: Human-readable description is called documentation
APIs should always publish descriptions
API space evolution → Description language co-evolution
Today's APIs often use HTTP and a resource-based approach
Competing languages for this space were RAML and Blueprint
Other approaches are supported by other description languages
GraphQL for Query-based APIs
AsyncAPI for Event-based APIs
gRPC for programming distributed systems
External APIs have gravitated towards HTTP/REST
Simple and intuitive API style and tech stack
Good fit for client-initiated synchronous interactions
Internal APIs have a bit more diversity
OpenAPI for request-based services
GraphQL for flexible front-ends
AsyncAPI for event-driven services
gRPC for remote procedure calls
OpenAPI has the largest combined market in the API space
Design tools to help create and discuss APIs
Validation tools to make sure APIs adhere to guidelines
Mocking tools to generate APIs from descriptions
Testing tools to validate implementations against descriptions
Fuzzing tools to test APIs for robustness
Documentation tools to create API documentation
Code generation tools for client and server sides
OpenAPI benefits from the network effect
Technologists can easily talk about designs
Organisations have a way to describe their building blocks
Teams can communicate in a more scalable way
Communications are possible across all these areas

presentation.title: OpenAPI Summit Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI
presentation.toc: APIs in general and their main description format OpenAPI have seen a lot of success since OpenAPI was created as Swagger in 2010 and became OpenAPI in 2016. What is the reason for its continued momentum and how does the landscape change with AI entering the picture? We look at APIs, OpenAPI and the way how AI plays a role in the API space. How can OpenAPI help you, how can the OpenAPI Initiative (OAI) help you using OpenAPI better, and how does AI influence the way how you design, develop, and deploy your APIs?

tr.td: Why this API exists; goal or outcome it supports
Whether an operation is safe, idempotent, retryable
Business-level category, tags, or ontology references
Signals for priority, deprecation, usage patterns

ul.li: + Compatible with existing OpenAPI tooling
+ Allows incremental enrichment without new stack
– Can become fragmented or inconsistent
– Limited expressiveness for intent and workflows
+ Tailored to AI agent goals and interaction models
+ Enables richer representations: workflows, outcomes, priorities
– Requires new tooling or transformation logic
– Introduces more complexity and coordination effort

slide.title: AI Maturity Starts with Asking the Right Questions

ul.li: We don't yet have a standard for AI-ready API metadata
But teams can start assessing APIs today
Is the API's purpose clear?
Are typical usage flows documented?
Is behavior like retries or side effects explicit?
Can others understand and use it without extra help?
Even informal answers help shape future strategy
Be ready to re-assess and refactor

slide.title: What AI Consumers Might Want to Know

ul.li: Does this API use AI at runtime?
Is the result deterministic or variable?
Which model is used and can I choose it?
Will my input be stored or used for training?
Can I influence or opt out of that behavior?

slide.title: Toward a Shared Extension for AI Metadata

ul.li: Expose key AI characteristics through OpenAPI extensions
Examples: model used, input retention, override options
Avoid vendor lock-in by aligning on community patterns
Start simple — evolve format over time as consensus grows

slide.title: Add Metadata Flexibly with OpenAPI Overlays

ul.li: Overlays let you patch OpenAPI docs without changing the base
Ideal for injecting runtime or environment-specific metadata
Enables layering AI disclosures per deployment or audience
Part of the OpenAPI Initiative — ready to be used today

slide.title: Shaping the Future Together — via the OpenAPI Initiative

ul.li: We've talked about descriptions, transparency, and standards
The OpenAPI Initiative is where this work happens
Follow the OAI, contribute ideas, join the conversation
If this is strategic for you — consider becoming a member
More alignment means better tools, stronger APIs, and faster progress
